newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary APV to continue Richter sell-off.
newsitem.headline: Hungary APV to continue Richter sell-off.

text.p: Hungary's state privatisation agency APV Rt said on Wednesday it would continue the sell-off of Hungarian pharmaceuticals company Richter Gedeon Rt in May.
"We believe the transaction will come some time at the end of May, following the privatisation of (oil company) MOL," APV's General Director Pal Szabo told a news conference.
APV said Hungary's Creditanstalt Securities and Schroders (in London) were picked as financial advisers and lead managers.
The transaction would include a private placement and a public share issue, Szabo said.
Details on the size of the transaction were not yet available but APV's stake would drop to somewhat above 25 percent, APV said.
At December 31, 1996, APV had a 38.98 percent stake in Richter.
On the Budapest Stock Exchange Richter closed at 12,300 forints, down 200.
APV has given no details of the planned timing of MOL's sale but the market expects it between late March and early May.
